required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Vaginal Fluid for Covid-19 Positivity in Women With Positive Nasofarengeal Covid-19 Test
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Vaginal Fluid for Covid-19 Positivity

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to investigate whether the Covid-19 is found in the vaginal swab samples of female patients diagnosed with covid-19, to evaluate the presence of Covid-19 and the risk of transmission of Covid-19 by intercourse or vaginal delivery.

detailed_description.textblock: Vaginal Covid-19 will be tested by taking vaginal swabs from female patients whose clinical findings are compatible with Covid-19 in AcÄ±badem Maslak Hospital. In patients with positive vaginal Covid-19 test, vaginal Covid-19 will be re-evaluated for the assessment of viral clearance.

primary_outcome.measure: Vaginal fluid Covid-19 PCR test result
primary_outcome.description: Vaginal fluid Covid-19 test positivity rate for patients whose nasofarengeal test is positive

secondary_outcome.description: The ratio of negative test results to previous positive results for vaginal fluid Covid-19 test

arm_group.description: Women with nasofarangeal Covid-19 PCR test is positive

intervention.description: Vaginal fluid samples are tested for Covid-19

study_pop.textblock:
Women who are older than18 years old, who are considered to be covid-19 clinically and radiologically positive or nasofarengeal Covid-19 PCR test is positive will be included.
Patients previously treated for covid-19 will be excluded from the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who are positive nasofarengeal Covid-19 PCR test result
- Women who are 18 years or older
- Women who had sexual intercourse before
Exclusion Criteria:
- who had medical treatment for Covid-19

eligibility.gender_description: Women who are older than 18 years old Women who had sexual intercourse before

reference.citation: Cui P, Chen Z, Wang T, Dai J, Zhang J, Ding T, Jiang J, Liu J, Zhang C, Shan W, Wang S, Rong Y, Chang J, Miao X, Ma X, Wang S. Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 detection in the female lower genital tract. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2020 Jul;223(1):131-134. doi: 10.1016/j.ajog.2020.04.038. Epub 2020 May 4.

results_reference.citation: Qiu L, Liu X, Xiao M, Xie J, Cao W, Liu Z, Morse A, Xie Y, Li T, Zhu L. SARS-CoV-2 Is Not Detectable in the Vaginal Fluid of Women With Severe COVID-19 Infection. Clin Infect Dis. 2020 Jul 28;71(15):813-817. doi: 10.1093/cid/ciaa375.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data of the patients will be shared without personel informations
